stats-comment: 41% of doctors in Ireland are foreign-born (OECD: 2016)
title: Wallonia translates COVID-19 information for migrants
text: SetisW, a Wallonian social interpretation service, is translating essential information on COVID-19 into 14 languages. This service helps migrant key workers and newcomers to Belgium to access and understand official safety advice on COVID-19.

title: Belgium allows asylum seekers to work
text: Belgium has allowed people who have applied for asylum to work throughout their application process and any appeal.

title: Germany strives to enlist migrant medics
text: Germany is investigating possible legal options to license foreign-qualified doctors. Some regions in the country, such as Saxony and Bavaria, have already taken steps to loosen licensing requirements for migrant doctors.

title: German region calls for foreign doctors
text: The Saxony State Medical Association has published a call on Facebook for German-speaking foreign-qualified doctors who do not yet have licenses. Saxony is known as the heartland of the far-right nationalist Alternative for Germany (AfD) party.

title: France allows refugees with non-EU medical certifications to practice
text: France has allowed refugees with non-EU medical qualifications to practice during the COVID-19 response. Refugees whose diplomas have not yet been recognised as an associate, under the responsibility of another doctor.

title: French region recruits refugees as seasonal workers
text: Seine-et-Marne has recruited refugees to fill gaps created by a halt in seasonal worker migration due to COVID-19. Refugees from local migrant and asylum shelters have been recruited to pick ripe strawberries and asparagus, and plant produce to harvest later in the year.

title: Ireland calls for retired doctors living abroad to return
text: On St Patrick’s Day, Ireland launched a call for retired doctors living abroad to return to aid the COVID-19 response. The country’s ‘Be on call for Ireland’ campaign has received more than 70,000 responses.

stats-comment: 25% of key workers in Ireland are migrants (Joint Research Centre: 2020)
title: Ireland offers financial and healthcare support for migrants
text: Ireland has moved to provide COVID-related healthcare to all, regardless of immigration status, including testing for COVID-19. The Pandemic Unemployment Payment provides financial assistance for all workers In Ireland, including regular and irregular migrants.

title: Village near Rome supported by migrant cooperative
text: In Campagnano di Roma, a cooperative of young African migrants called Barikama are growing, packing and delivering boxes of fresh food to the local community during the COVID-19 outbreak.

quote-text: It’s a beautiful thing that we are helping feed the community in these terrible times.
title: Lithuania suspends deportations
text: Lithuania has suspended deportations of foreigners with expired leave to stay during quarantine. The country has also released migrants from administrative liability for illegal stay.

title: Asylum seekers in Dutch village disinfect grocery carts to protect population
text: In Ter Apel, a village in the Netherlands, asylum seekers have volunteered to disinfect grocery carts, walkers, and keys to protect fellow citizens from COVID-19 at a local supermarket.

title: Norway sends healthcare staff to Italy
text: Norway has sent a team of 25 doctors, nurses, and logistical staff, to aid Italy’s COVID-19 response. The team is based in Lombardy, Italy’s worst-hit region.
